name: Egypt
description: Egypt, the gift of the Nile, is a land of ancient wonders and dramatic landscapes. Situated in North Africa, it boasts a rich history dating back millennia, evident in its iconic pyramids, temples, and tombs. Beyond its historical significance, Egypt offers diverse natural environments, from the fertile Nile Valley to the vast deserts and the Red Sea coastline.  Its strategic location has shaped its culture and economy, making it a vital crossroads between Africa, Asia, and Europe.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Egypt is the most populous Arab country and one of the most populous countries in Africa.
quickFacts.detail: The population is concentrated along the Nile River and in urban centers like Cairo and Alexandria.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Egypt covers a vast area encompassing the Nile Delta, the Western Desert, and the Eastern Desert.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Cairo is the largest city in the Arab world and a major economic, cultural, and political center.
quickFacts.detail: It's located on the Nile River and is known for its bustling markets, historic mosques, and vibrant nightlife.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Modern Standard Arabic is used for formal communication, while various Egyptian dialects are spoken in everyday life.
quickFacts.detail: Coptic is an ancient language with a unique script and historical significance.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Egyptian Pound is the official currency of Egypt.
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, and it's advisable to check current rates before traveling.

climateData.title: Egyptian Climate
climateData.description: Egypt experiences a hot desert climate with significant seasonal variations. The Nile Valley enjoys a more temperate climate due to the river's influence, while the rest of the country is characterized by scorching summers and mild winters.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is extremely hot and dry, with temperatures often exceeding 40°C (104°F). Rainfall is minimal.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a welcome respite from the summer heat, with temperatures gradually decreasing and rainfall increasing. It's a pleasant time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is mild and dry, with average temperatures ranging from 15°C to 25°C (59°F to 77°F). It's the most popular time to visit Egypt.
activities: Relaxing on the Red Sea beaches

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings warm temperatures and blooming flowers, creating a beautiful landscape. Rainfall is moderate.

naturalWonders.name: The White Desert
naturalWonders.description: The White Desert is a surreal and otherworldly landscape of chalk rock formations sculpted by wind and sand over millions of years. Its stark white appearance creates a breathtaking and unforgettable experience.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in the Western Desert, the White Desert is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The formations are composed of pure white chalk, creating a unique and dramatic visual effect.  The area is also home to diverse wildlife, including desert foxes and birds.

naturalWonders.name: Siwa Oasis
naturalWonders.description: Siwa Oasis is a remote and tranquil oasis in the Western Desert, renowned for its ancient ruins, natural springs, and unique culture. It offers a glimpse into a traditional way of life far removed from the hustle and bustle of modern Egypt.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Siwa Oasis is home to the Oracle of Amun, where Cleopatra is said to have awaited the arrival of Mark Antony. The oasis is surrounded by dramatic sand dunes and offers a variety of activities, including swimming, hiking, and exploring ancient temples.

naturalWonders.name: The Nile River
naturalWonders.description: The Nile River is the lifeblood of Egypt, providing water for agriculture, transportation, and sustenance. It has shaped the country's history, culture, and economy for millennia.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Nile flows northward through Egypt, originating in Lake Victoria in Tanzania and emptying into the Mediterranean Sea. Its fertile banks have supported a thriving civilization for thousands of years.  Cruises along the Nile offer a unique perspective on Egypt's ancient monuments and landscapes.
viewingTips: Visit the temples along the river

biodiversityCategory.name: Desert Wildlife
biodiversityCategory.description: Egypt's deserts are home to a surprising array of wildlife adapted to the harsh conditions. These animals have evolved unique strategies for survival in the arid environment.

statistics.details: Such as the desert fox, fennec fox, and addax antelope.

notableSpecies.name: Addax Antelope
notableSpecies.significance: An iconic desert species, once abundant in the Sahara.

notableSpecies.name: Fennec Fox
notableSpecies.significance: The smallest fox species, adapted to the desert environment.

ecosystemData.title: Egyptian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Egypt's ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from the fertile Nile Delta to the arid deserts and the Red Sea coral reefs. Each ecosystem supports a unique array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Red Sea Coral Reefs
biodiversityCategories.description: The Red Sea coral reefs are a vibrant and diverse ecosystem, supporting a wide range of marine life.

notableSpecies.name: Moray Eel
notableSpecies.significance: A predatory fish found in the Red Sea.

activities.title: Activities in Egypt
activities.description: Egypt offers a wide range of activities for travelers of all interests and abilities, from exploring ancient ruins to enjoying the Red Sea beaches.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the diverse landscapes of Egypt on foot, from the White Desert to the Sinai Mountains.

activities.name: White Desert Trekking
activities.description: Hike through the surreal landscape of the White Desert, exploring its unique rock formations.

activities.name: Sinai Mountain Hiking
activities.description: Challenge yourself with a hike in the rugged mountains of Sinai, enjoying stunning views and diverse wildlife.
activities.requirements: Hiking experience, appropriate clothing, navigation skills

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports along the Red Sea coastline, including diving, snorkeling, and windsurfing.

activities.name: Red Sea Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and diverse marine life of the Red Sea.

activities.name: Windsurfing
activities.description: Catch the wind and glide across the Red Sea waters.

clothing.summer: Lightweight, breathable clothing, swimwear, hat, sunglasses
clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, sweater, jacket, scarf, gloves
